snippet: Dr. Dehavenon became an anthropological authority on poverty, hunger and homelessness in New York City after her husband, William Kapell, died in a plane crash.
abstract: Anna Lou Dehavenon, urban anthropologist who became an authority on poverty, hunger and homelessness in New York City, dies at age 85.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Dehavenon became an anthropological authority on poverty, hunger and homelessness in New York City after her husband, William Kapell, died in a plane crash.

headline.seo: Anna Lou Dehavenon, Urban Anthropologist, Dies at 85
headline.main: Anna Lou Dehavenon, Who Drew Attention to the Homeless, Dies at 85
headline.print_headline: Anna Lou Dehavenon, 85; Drew Attention to the Homeless
